entry.title: The Doorway
entry.summary:
Author: GothamiteEditor

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 16,875Chapters: 8/?Kudos: 1,289

Summary: Peter should really learn not to let his curiosity or desire to prove he's worthy to be Spider-Man make decisions for him.Or.Peter Parker ends up in the Watch Tower, humiliates himself in front of a dude named Superman (no hyphen) and then is stranded with no way home. All because he couldn't not touch a magic door.Captain Marvel doesn't want the world to explode because someone touched a magical door.Superman just wanted to have non-ruined shoes.Batman is trying very hard not to adopt a child he can't keep.Formerly known as “Why You Shouldn’t Mess with Magic Doors”

entry.title: Single Dad Saturdays
entry.summary:
Author: Sugarof5oaks

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 7,912Chapters: 4/?Kudos: 15

Summary: Logan Howlett never thought he would need a partner. OK, maybe need is not the right word. Logan would like a partner; however, when you are a single dad of five kids ranging in age from high school to preschool, your dating pool is very slim. However, that all can change one day when his nosy neighbors, who are best friends, decide to help with his dating life. Not to mention the sexy new neighbor that tolerates Logan's brooding behavior, will Logan find love, or will his temper close off opportunities that prevent him from finding love again?

entry.title: The Weight of Expectations
entry.summary:
Author: mustangisinflames

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,547Chapters: 2/2Kudos: 29

Summary: The hologram of his biological father had initially made him overjoyed. To be able to see one of the parents who'd created him, to talk to him, to, at last, ask questions and have them answered - it had been everything he'd ever wanted since ma and pa had told him how they'd found him as a baby. It should've been a slotting into place, a joining of parts; a filling in of that terrible, aching gap in his chest he'd felt ever since the day his powers started appearing and he knew he was irrevocably different. This secluded haven, this part of Krypton tucked safely away in sheets of ice, snow, and permafrost, should've been a comfort.Instead, it was a burden. Clark struggles with an identity he feels he isn't worthy of.Bruce knows exactly who he must be.

entry.title: First Light
entry.summary:
Author: lighthouse_inkwell

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,208Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 30

Summary: Bruce Wayne is overwhelmed.In trying to get initiatives off the ground that will actually improve Gotham's infrastructure, he unwillingly goes on a press tour in Metropolis, where he is met with increasingly personal questions about his reappearance into society, and of course (as always) his parents tragic deaths. Panic attacks ensue, Bruce meets a particularly polite reporter who talks him out of it, but is met with a brand new problem when a miscommunication leads the public into thinking Bruce is dating said reporter.Clark convinces Bruce that answering questions about a fake relationship would be leagues easier than answering questions about dead parents. Bruce agrees. And totally not because Clark has the most charming smiling he's ever seen.

entry.title: The Buttered Cat Paradox
entry.summary:
Author: writersagainstwritersblock

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 27,026Chapters: 12/?Kudos: 369

Summary: “No comment.”“You don’t know what I was going to ask,” Clark said with a hint of a smile. “Maybe I just wanted to congratulate you on catching the Film Freak.”Bruce gave him a flat look.“Or maybe I think I can help.”“With a case of vandalism?”Clark stepped in front of him. “It’s not vandalism and you know it, detective.”“And what makes you say that?”“If it were vandalism it would be something a lot more juvenile. To the point. It wouldn’t claim there were seventeen missing kids. That’s public outcry.”“Is that so?”“That and I tried to do a story on the growing number of homeless children last month and I got shut down. According to the last count, the numbers have been decreasing, but there’s been no change in policies, no extra funding to CPS, or shelters, or even an increase in the number of inmates in the juvenile detention center. So where are they going?” Detective Bruce Wayne may have the highest solve rate in Gotham, but if he wants to solve this case, he’ll need the help of an elusive street kid, and while Dick Grayson always lands on his feet, he usually lands himself right into trouble.

entry.title: It's Not One
entry.summary:
Author: kingsarah

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 41,296Chapters: 5/9Kudos: 81

Summary: One name written over a heart tying two people together. One pair of soulmates trying to figure out what that means.Clark and Bruce have finally come together and accepted each other as soulmates, but it’s not happily ever after yet. One thing after another causes turbulence in their budding relationship. Just because they are soulmates doesn’t mean the path is smooth. But maybe it’s not one thing that defines a relationship, but innumerable little actions over time.Sequel to Redamancy.

entry.title: Take the leap (I'll always catch you)
entry.summary:
Author: Cringe_Fella

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 18,496Chapters: 2/2Kudos: 193

Summary: “I knew I could take it! And I did!” Superman sputtered, defensively. He was actually losing his cool, now. No one really got to him quite like Bats, after all. “It's not like I put anyone else in danger! Why do you even care about this so much?!” “Because you went down, Kal! Of course I care, why wouldn't I care- I'm in love with you, you stupid idiot!” Hal Jordan nearly fell on his ass, stumbling over some rubble.Say what now.

entry.title: As Though the Sun Will Never Set
entry.summary:
Author: Scarlet609

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 11,864Chapters: 1/65Kudos: 18

Summary: Bruce Wayne has done something to get him sent to live with the Kents, he thought it would be mundane and unfulfilling, but he soon finds himself caught between something dangerous and wonderful. There are factions moving in to claim his prize, his newly found trump card and he's not ready to let it go.Enter Clark, the soft-spoken Kansas farm boy, just a little too wholesome, a little too comfortable with cows and crickets and just a little too strong for his own good.As Bruce enters the plotters and begins weaving his web of seduction and treachery, mundanity seems further and further away, slipping through Clark's fingers.

entry.summary:
Author: lonely_dream_walker

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 9,539Chapters: 12/?Kudos: 82

Summary: Clark Kent is a journalist who has recently moved from Metropolis to Gotham. He has just been given the task of interviewing the multibillionaire Bruce Wayne who, unbeknownst to him, is the superhero Batman. Although this job appears simple, it quickly becomes more difficult as Clark, in his Superman persona, must conceal his hero identity from Bruce while trying to protect Gotham from a mysterious and dangerous enemy.

entry.title: Can We Just Pretend For a Moment? Like Real People Do
entry.summary:
Author: Wannabewerewolf

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,132Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 11

Summary: Batman has a rough patrol and Clark just wants to pretend for one night his boyfriend is normal. After getting beat to Hell Batman is still refusing help until Clark offers an olive branch for just one night. To pretend just for a moment he isn't The Batman but rather Bruce Wayne. Can Batman let go for just a night? This is my excuse to beat Bruce up so Clark can put him back together.

entry.title: Attention (is the beginning of devotion)
entry.summary:
Author: Dopamine_Knight

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 11,122Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 68

Summary: .Bruce Wayne is a man of many secrets. His identity as Batman, the falsity of Brucie Wayne, his one-sided love that caused the fall of Gotham’s White Knight... And a current, silly crush that is not as bad as Selina makes it to be. He knows Clark Kent’s only secret: he is Superman. He tries to guard this secret as close as he can to his chest, but one night he slips. And he thinks he’s just made Clark’s hatred of him all the more justifiable. ...But does he? Does Kal-El have only one secret, after all? .
